evidence.pdf_reference: Converting CO 2 into renewable solar fuel using photocatalysts is one of the most ideal solutions for environmental challenges and energy crises.Here, the solid-solid Z-scheme Zn 0.5 Cd 0.5 SAug-C 3 N 4 (ZCSAuCN) heterojunction showed improved photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 due to the enhanced visible light consumption, fast dissolution of photogenerated electron-hole pairs, quick interfacial transfer process of electrons, and enlarged surface area.Under visible-light irradiation, methanol (CH 3 OH) was

transmission in semiconductors occurred followed by rapid recombination between electrons in CB of CN and the holes in VB of ZCS.The photoexcited holes in ZCS oxidize with H 2 O to form O 2 and H while the photoexcited electrons in CB of CN reduce CO 2 to form CH 3 OH and other carbon fuels.and H slowly combine the adsorbed CO to form alkoxy structure.Finally, the alkoxy desorb and protonate to form methanol 68,69. To investigate the radicals generated during the photocatalytic process, electron spin

irradiation, both ZCS and CN can be excited and react with the mixture of CO 2 and H 2 O vapor in situ generated before the photocatalytic process; Eqs.(3)-( 13) express the electrochemical pathways from CO 2 photoreduction to solar fuels on the surface of catalyst. evidence.pdf_reference: N 2 gas was passed through the reactor (30 min) to ensure complete anaerobic condition within the reactor system before light irradiation.The mixture of CO 2 and H 2 O vapor were in situ generated by the reaction of NaHCO 3 (0.084 g added into the reactor before seal) and H 2 SO 4 aqueous solution (0.3 mL, 0.2 M) which was introduced into the reactor using a syringe before light irradiation.A 300 W Xe lamp with a UV-cutoff filter ( 420 nm) was used as a light source and placed at a distance of 15 cm over

at a distance of 15 cm over the photocatalytic reactor.After one hour of light irradiation, the CO 2 reduced products were analyzed by a Shimadzu GC-2014C gas chromatograph (Japan) equipped with a flame ionized detector and methanizer. Photocurrents were calculated by a CHI CHI660C electrochemical analyzer (China) in a standard three-electrode arrangement.The apparatus and method used for these measurements have been described in detail elsewhere 33.

spectroscopy (XPS) was tested by an ultrahigh vacuum VG ESCALAB 210 electron spectrometer.Fourier transform infrared (FTIR) spectra were conducted using an IR Affinity-1 FTIR spectrometer (Shimadzu, Japan).UV-vis absorbance spectra of prepared photocatalysts were acquired from a Shimadzu UV-2550 UV-vis spectrophotometer (Japan) using BaSO 4 as the standard for reflectance spectra.
